intro: [WRONG START] Ornu dipetala, commonly known as the two-petaled ornus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces pods that contain several seeds, which are often dispersed by wind. Ornus dipetala is typically found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
